intro: Pavetta warneckei, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and often have a yellow or white color with prominent stamens.
